message.content:
cs.LO, cs.DM, cs.FL, cs.LT, cs.CC

Reasoning: The paper deals with formal languages, logic formulas, and recognisers, which are all topics within the realm of theoretical computer science. The use of Stone duality and topo-algebraic constructions suggests a connection to mathematical logic and category theory, which are often found in the cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity) sub-categories. The focus on the Schützenberger product and its applications to language recognition suggests a connection to formal language theory, which is often found in the cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) sub-category. The use of ultrafilters on words suggests a connection to combinatorics, which is often found in the cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) sub-category. Finally, the use of the Vietoris construction and its dual functor suggests a connection to topology, which is often found in the cs.LT (General Topology) sub-category.
